sentences.en: " Many happy returns! " Emily said to me at my birthday party.
sentences.cn: 在我的生日聚会上埃米莉说道 “ 祝你福如东海,寿比南山! ”

sentences.en: At her death Emily Dickinson left over a thousand unpublished poems.
sentences.cn: 艾米莉·狄更生死时留下一千多首未经发表的诗.

sentences.en: At times, Henrietta would tell me she felt slightly guilty that Emily enjoyed staying with her so much.
sentences.cn: 有时，亨利埃塔会对我说，埃米莉如此喜欢和她待在一起，让她感到有些内疚。
埃米莉∙克利夫顿，卒于1865年

sentences.en: Emily confessed to me that she had not written to her mother.
sentences.cn: 艾米莉向我自白,她没写信给她母亲.

sentences.en: Emily Dickinson gives the sense of having come before her time.
sentences.cn: 埃米莉?狄更生给人的感觉是:生不逢辰,超越时代了.

sentences.en: Emily Dickinson too is unsure how to pitch her work.
sentences.cn: 艾米莉·狄更森也不知如何为自己的作品调音.

sentences.en: Emily is a country music fan.
sentences.cn: 艾米莉是位乡村音乐迷.

sentences.en: Emily kept circling around her mother.
sentences.cn: 埃米莉围着她妈妈转个不停。

sentences.en: Emily turned and threw her a suggestive grin.
sentences.cn: 埃米莉转过头，冲她意味深长地一笑。

sentences.en: Emily's mercurial temperament made her difficult to live with.
sentences.cn: 埃米莉脾气反复无常，很难与她相处。

sentences.en: Nine - year - old Emily Hoffman of Humble, Texas, was born weighing nearly 11 pounds.
sentences.cn: 9 岁 的埃米莉-霍夫曼来自得克萨斯州的汉布尔,她出生时体重接近11磅.

sentences.en: Poor Emily. Her kinsfolk should come to her.
sentences.cn: 可怜的埃米莉，她的亲人应该到她这来。
她疯狂地紧紧抓住埃米莉的胳膊。

sentences.en: Their vocabulary, like that of Emily Dickinson, acquired regal overtones.
sentences.cn: 他们的词汇, 一如艾米莉?狄更生的词汇, 也有了高雅的情调.

sentences.en: With my family –my wife Mona and our children Emily, Dylan, and Madeline –we’re excited to have this opportunity to serve the President and the people of the United States of America.
sentences.cn: 我和我的家人──即我的夫人蒙娜以及我们的孩子埃米莉、迪伦和梅德林──都很兴奋有这个机会为美国总统及美国人民效劳。

phrases.tran_cn: n. 艾米莉·迪金森（美国十九世纪著名女诗人）
